title: Configure should work offline
body_html: Currently, configure set some environment variables and invoke bazel fetch. When the fetch fails, due to network issue for example, the environment variables are also lost. I tried to source ./configure, but the shell died instantly. The only way I found to workaround this is to replace bazel fetch with bash in configure, then manually run bazel fetch a few times until it succeed. IMHO, configure should do the configuration separately instead of as part of bazel fetch.

body: Currently, `configure` set some environment variables and invoke `bazel fetch`. When the fetch fails, due to network issue for example, the environment variables are also lost. I tried to `source ./configure`, but the shell died instantly. The only way I found to workaround this is to replace `bazel fetch` with `bash` in `configure`, then manually run `bazel fetch` a few times until it succeed. IMHO, `configure` should do the configuration separately instead of as part of `bazel fetch`.
